medical_history.chief_complaint: Developmental delay and dysmorphic features in a 4-year-old female patient.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's developmental delays and facial dysmorphism have progressively worsened since birth, starting with complications of generalized edema and fetal distress. At age 4, she can walk independently but is unable to run. She also speaks single words but not full sentences.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic lung disease of prematurity, hearing impairment, laryngomalacia type A, biliary atresia managed by a Kasai procedure, and atrial septal defect (ASD) II.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes genetic variants; the mother carries the heterozygous variant c.1454C > T in the GUSB gene and the paternal grandmother carries the heterozygous variant c.104C > A.
